newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish H1 1997 share turnover climbs 54 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Danish H1 1997 share turnover climbs 54 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Danish share turnover rose by 54 percent in the first six months of 1997 compared to first-half 1996, with bond turnover only one percent up on the same period last year, the Danish Securities Centre reported on Thursday.
The centre said that share turnover for the period totalled 75 billion crowns in nominal value, the equivalent of 620 million crowns per trading day.

It said bond turnover for the half-year amounted to a nominal 10,558 billion crowns, corresponding to 87 billion crowns per trading day with 70 percent of bond trading and 16 percent of share trading taking place between securities dealers. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969652
